channel.title: Launchpad dual factotum loop mangler/stutter patch
channel.description: https://youtu.be/7Zu9Swy2NGw Hi all, Just finished off my loop mangling factotum patch. It has a 4 bar looper going into 2 factotums, each with a filter and a midi Looper (7 slots, 4 bars each). There are envelopes for pitch and stretch and envelopes for each factotum's vca. The factotums also work on the live input. There's also 2x 4 bar automation loopers that record any parameter changes, and 16 preset slots. Parameters are controlled by a launch control xl and factotums are 'played' with a launchpad. The two 4x4 grids on the right play the factotums with pads set to different settings (different octaves/speeds/directions). When you play a pad it records and then loops for as long as you hold the pad down. Recording length is set with a knob and can go from tiny unquantized lengths to lengths quantized in 16ths. Factotum loops can be up to a bar long. You can also change it so it holds the last recording and the pads just change pitch/direction. The two columns on the right are the clipslots for recording the factotum grids. The two orange columns are the presets. Here's the patch- malcolms grandaughter.axp (282.1 KB) The patch won't work standalone as it's part of a 3 axoloti setup... Bass-station Looper, synced delay, chorus, reverb and a drum machine.

item.title: Launchpad dual factotum loop mangler/stutter patch

item.description:
@reubenfinger wrote:

Awesome Matt, much obliged, can't wait to give it a shot

item.title: Launchpad dual factotum loop mangler/stutter patch
item.dc:creator: @reubenfinger
item.description:
@reubenfinger wrote:

I like to utilise the LFO and P-Locks of a midi track from my digitakt for factotum animation, but yeah I have been meaning to do it in house [on the axo] and getting more into recording automation that way,
I guess using a table to record cc's, but my sdram is always overflowing, [i'm using a 4loop and a factotum] does the automation table require alot of sdram in your experience?

Read full topic
item.source: Launchpad dual factotum loop mangler/stutter patch

Thanks!

Envelopes and factotum are pretty fun, especially in the pitch and stretch inputs. I've been meaning to try lfos in the stretch inputs, could be great.

item.title: Launchpad dual factotum loop mangler/stutter patch
item.dc:creator: @MattilynMattroe
item.description:
@MattilynMattroe wrote:

Hi all,

Just finished off my loop mangling factotum patch. It has a 4 bar looper going into 2 factotums, each with a filter and a midi Looper (7 slots, 4 bars each).
There are envelopes for pitch and stretch and envelopes for each factotum's vca. The factotums also work on the live input.

There's also 2x 4 bar automation loopers that record any parameter changes, and 16 preset slots.

Parameters are controlled by a launch control xl and factotums are 'played' with a launchpad.

The two 4x4 grids on the right play the factotums with pads set to different settings (different octaves/speeds/directions). When you play a pad it records and then loops for as long as you hold the pad down. Recording length is set with a knob and can go from tiny unquantized lengths to lengths quantized in 16ths. Factotum loops can be up to a bar long. You can also change it so it holds the last recording and the pads just change pitch/direction.

The two columns on the right are the clipslots for recording the factotum grids.

The two orange columns are the presets.

Here's the patch-

malcolms grandaughter.axp (282.1 KB)

The patch won't work standalone as it's part of a 3 axoloti setup... Bass-station Looper, synced delay, chorus, reverb and a drum machine.
